intro: Stenogyne angustifolia var. spathulata, commonly known as the broadleaf stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
